result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph M. Gronitz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:07 Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 18cf35 and 18tr298 and 15cm151 - revocation
State moves to dismiss 18tr298 and  counts 1 and 3 - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed - Guilty plea to Count 2-   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Pfeifer/Burns/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing
15cm151 - Court sentences to 300 days- Credit for 230 - (Time served)
18cf35 - Court WHS and POP for 3 years - 3 year IID/3 year Revocation/Assessment
Fine of $1569 plus $250 DNA/$50 IID - $38.25 blood draw-/Supervision fees   Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office. Payment plan provided - $100 /month allowed
9 months jail -huber for all purposes- Commence on/before 5-21-18 @ 8am - (court allowing release today since revocation is time served )  87 days credit if revoked
Submit DNA sample- any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO - 
Appeal rights/Voting rights given -  Review hearing scheduled for December 3, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

2:36 p.m. Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr 993, 15cm379, 14cm428, 15cm253, 15cm151, 15cm422, 15cm300. Cirillie to represent on all cases -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea - Defendant statement to in patient treatment - Defendant request Court to contact Koinonia to request them to open a bed for him - Court states defendant should talk to Attorney Cirilli - Court will make phone call on defendant's behalf if Stip is filed by parties
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

3:35 p.m Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr993, 14cm428, 15cm300, 15 cm 151, 15cm253, Defendant states he has hired Attorney Cirilli.  Cirilli's schedule did not permit him to be here today. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 3:37 p.m.

03:30 pm - Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm253, 15cm151 and 14cm428.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining retainer for Cirilli.  Defendant states money saved for retainer was used for bail.  Defendant states still short approximately $500 for retainer.  Schiek does not object to adjournment.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Adjourned 03:32 p.m.

01:54 pm - Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm253 (initial), 15cm151, 15tr993, and 14cm428 (AIA).  Defendant states had an appointment set up today with attorney Gary Cirilli to represent on all cases.  In 15cm253 -   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states in process of retaining attorney Gary Cirilli,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Adjourned 02:01 pm

02:27 pm - Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cm428, 15cm151 and 14tr993.  Bayne-Allison states has not been appointed in 15cm151.  Grontiz states would like to retain private attorney and requests additional time to retain.  Court releases Bayne-Allison from court appointment.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:59 pm - Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states trying to obtain Atty Cirilli.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
